name: Aquavit Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the house is beautiful. Yes, the view is excellent. Yes, the breakfasts are delicious. But what makes this place stand out are Ole and Linda. They were very hospitable and I benefited from both their good company and friendly advice. Would stay here again without hesitation. Without a doubt, one of the best places that I stayed during my time in South Africa. A very good and restful experience for us.
reviews.title: Warm, Comfortable, Unique Guest House in PB

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Aquavit for four nights, on our tour along the garden route in September. We stayed at 5 different places, but Aquavit was by far the best. Hosts Linda and Ole were superb. They were so helpful, and full of suggestions about dinner venues, or places to visit in the area. Only now do we wish we had stayed longer at Aquavit. The house is an architectural phenomenon, and the views spectacular. All in all it was faultless, and we will definitely visit again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: David and Isabel Delaney from Edinburgh, Scotland
reviews.title: Four weary travellers arrive from Scotland!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can honestly say that, having been to SA several times now, this is absolutely, in every sense, THE best accommodation we've stayed in and will be a very tough act to follow, wherever in the world we go. Linda and Ole (and the two dogs, Beau and Dakota, with whom we instantly fell in love!!) are the perfect hosts, and are so attentive to your every need or desire. The food was excellent, and well, what can we say about the rooms and the views - they are just out of this world. The accommodation is fabulous, with the decor and furnishings being of the highest standard. Certainly anyone travelling in the Plettenberg Bay area would be very foolish to miss the opportunity of accepting probably the finest hospitality SA has to offer. Having spent 5 wonderful nights at Aquavit, we will certainly be back. Keep up the good work Linda and Ole - we hope to see you again very soon!!
reviews.title: Great find in Plettenberg Bay

reviews.text: As other reviewers have stated, Aquavit is a fantastic guest house. The view is magnificent, Ole and Linda are wonderful hosts, the design of the house is unique and inviting and our room which turned out to be the honeymoon suite with its pool side location had a view beyond comparison. The breakfasts whether served in the house or on the great deck were scrumptious. Again, what a view. We only stayed two nights but should have skipped our Knysna lodge and spent one more night at Aquavit.
reviews.title: The most fanatic Place to stay Aquavit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only had the immense pleasure of spending one night at the beautiful Aquavit guest house with some very welcoming hosts, Linda, Ole and the dogs!
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to wait until we arrived in Plettenberg Bay to book our accommodation, and luckily, we didn’t stray beyond “A” on the guest houses directory, for a change our laziness paid off! We arrived on Linda & Ole’s doorstep and were greeted by Linda and Beau, one of their gold retrievers. Linda was very welcoming and eager to show us around their truly magnificent home. We were completely bowled over by her warmth and were gutted that we were only going to be spending one night here.
reviews.title: 5 star accommodation
Beautiful property but lots of little issues.
reviews.text: The bedrooms are beautiful, very tastefully decorated with each overlooking the gorgeous bay. As we visited in the off season and the guest house was quiet, we had our choice of rooms. We were like kids in a sweet store trying to decide which room to lay our heads down in, they were all equally beautiful! The bed was extremely comfortable; the spacious en-suite had a good supply of towels and toiletries. Each room is equipped with a safety deposit box, satellite t.v., tea and coffee making facilities along with some Ferrero Rocher and biscuits.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was exquisite - the nicest on our trip. They really take such pride in the presentation of breakfast too whilst also serving it on their veranda, weather permitting, to make sure you get an opportunity to soak up the stunning views of Plettenberg Bay.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During breakfast, Linda asked what we had planned for our day. We weren’t entirely certain until Ole kindly made a number of suggestions. With our itinerary now in hand we were ready to leave, however, Linda wouldn’t let us go until she had rang each place we were planning to visit to let them know we would be coming and to book us in for lunch and some tours. She also phoned the guest house we were staying in that evening to inform them that our arrival time was going to be much later than we had planned.
reviews.title: 1st class guest house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Aquavit for one night whilst driving the Garden Route. Linda and Ole have a beautiful and welcoming home....and an amazing wine cellar! Our room was very well appointed with a really comfortable bed and huge bathroom. The breakfast was gorgeous and it was lovely to sit on the balcony overlooking Plettenberg Bay.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Home!

reviews.text: It was a pleasure to stay at Aquavit and should we return to Plettenberg we would definitely book again!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh...and the 3 wooden giraffes heads-I wish we had been able to find some! The house is filled with lots of great artifacts!
reviews.title: A really exceptional guest house

reviews.text: We only stayed at Aquavit for one night but had a wonderful stay. Lovely people, jaw dropping views and inspiring decor. Would be my first choice every time in Plett.
reviews.title: Simply the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights at Aquavit during our honeymoon on the Garden Route and this guest house really is in a class of its own. It is in a stunning location, high on the hill overlooking Plett Bay. It is immaculately decorated, supremely stylish and luxurious in every respect. The living areas, both inside and outside, just beg you to get out your camera! Bedrooms and bathrooms are large and very well equipped; clearly a great deal of thought has gone into their planning. This is what we British might think of as the very best kind of boutique hotel rather than a guest house.
reviews.title: Beautiful!!!

reviews.text: Nothing can compare to Aquavit. The building is straight out of Architectural Digest, incredibly beautiful with fantastic details. My room was stunning and had everything I could ever dream of wanting. There was even an adjustable bed. On the one night there were people in the next room, I never heard a sound. The hosts, Linda and Ole, were warm and created a great atmosphere in which I felt very much at home. They took care of everything from restaurant reservations to laundry. Breakfast was an amazing feast, plentiful and very well done. In addition to having wireless access everywhere, they have a laptop available in the comfy lounge. No detail is missed, down to radiant heat in the bathroom floor. This is truly a world-class accomodation!
reviews.title: The Best Guesthouse Anywhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Aquavit Guest House for 3 nights whilst we were travelling along the Garden Route. Linda and Ole were so friendly and welcoming and had so many recommendations for what to see, do and where to eat and they took care booking everything for us. Nothing was too much trouble. The Guest House has been done up and is immaculate. The rooms were ultra comfortable and after a great night's sleep we would have a delicious breakfast on the outdoor terrace with stunning views. We would definitely recommend this Guest House! Thanks Linda and Ole!
reviews.title: Beautiful, all our needs were catered for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As bright as a new pin, beautiful beyond compare and Ollie's stellar bacon too! The view of the bay and the dreamy mountains took our breath away; this is the ultimate place to stay on the Garden Route. There's even a soothing waterfall by the front door. We just wallowed in the comfort. The concierge service was caring, comprehensive and superbly efficient. At the end of a wonderful, rejuvenating four days we had been helped to see everything in the area which mattered. The only time we could have chosen a better restaurant was when we didn't take Linda and Ollie's advice!
reviews.title: So brilliant!

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time! The room was beautiful and we had the best breakfast ever in SA!!! Linda and Ole were very welcoming and very helpful when indicating us the best restaurants in Plett. Wished we could have stayed longer in this beautiful and romantic guest house. We will be back as soon as we go back to Plett again.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What to say? The previous reviews have said it all but will gush anyway - We so enjoyed our stay here! Aquavit is a beautifully planned and decorated guest house, the breakfast is delish, stunning views and Linda & Ole are consummate hosts (as well as their two cute & friendly golden retrievers).
reviews.title: Brilliant! we arrived for one night and stayed for three

aka: Aquavit Guest House Hotel Plettenberg Bay
description: Aquavit Guest House is a newly built contemporary home with 5 en-suite guestrooms offering the most updated fixtures and finishes. Aquavit has a welcoming environment with attention to detail to ensure your stay a memorable one. Our guestrooms boast single, queen and king beds. A beautiful bathtub awaits you in our luxury king canopy suite "One" with salt crystals to soothe away your stress. The terrace has an area to relax, within steps of the 10-metre Infinity pool and lovely garden, where you can gaze at the sea and mountains. A full gourmet English breakfast is served on the terrace with attention to detail so your breakfast will taste as good as it looks - a perfect start to your day! All our en-suite guestrooms have spectacular views and steps out to a terrace or patio, 32” DSTV, WIFI, Internet availability, and private lounge. Our entire staff welcomes you, including Beau and Dakota, our Golden Retrievers who will also happily greet you upon your arrival. Come see why we are called “Water of Life”!
